arts.ttl: Jean-Philippe Mateta discharged from hospital after ear injury in FA Cup tie
arts.sum: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner believes Millwall goalkeeper Liam Roberts’ actions could have ended the career of the France forward.

We are very pleased to confirm that JP Mateta has this evening been discharged from St George’s Hospital where he received specialist treatment and 25 stitches to a severe laceration to his left ear. All scans were clear and JP is feeling well.

arts.ttl: Is Crystal Palace vs Millwall on TV today? Channel, live stream and FA Cup kick-off time
arts.sum: The FA Cup returns this weekend as Crystal Palace prepare to face Millwall in the fifth round of the competition. Crystal Palace's clash against Millwall in the FA Cup is scheduled to kick off at 12.15pm on Saturday, March 1 at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace chairman Steve Parish slams Millwall star for 'terrible' Jean-Philippe Mateta tackle
arts.sum: Crystal Palace chairman Steve Parish has strongly criticised Millwall goalkeeper Liam Roberts for his 'terrible, terrible' tackle that resulted in Jean-Philippe Mateta being taken to hospital urgently. "In all the time I've watched football, I've never seen a challenge like it.

arts.ttl: Jean-Phillipe Mateta rushed to hospital, horror FA Cup kung-fu kick and Crystal Palace rage
arts.sum: One of English football's most senior referees Michael Oliver allowed play to continue before calling for a stoppage, issuing no punishment. The aftermath then saw a nine-minute effort from Palace medical staff to treat their player, providing the 27-year-old with an oxygen mask before carrying him straight to the far-right corner of Selhurst Park where a precautionary ambulance was waiting, as opposed to into the dressing room.

arts.ttl: Chelsea loanee Ben Chilwell delivers verdict on first Crystal Palace start in Millwall FA Cup win
arts.sum: “You can train as hard as you want every day, do big training sessions and try and get as much out of it as you can, but there’s nothing like playing a match,” said the former Leicester player. “The fact that I’m getting in the positions – even in the 90th minute today I was trying to run it behind them and get crosses in – I was feeling good, my body felt great.

arts.ttl: 'It was amazing': Oliver Glasner stunned by what £30m Crystal Palace player did in today's FA Cup win over Millwall
arts.sum: Crystal Palace are through to the FA Cup quarter-finals after running out 3-1 winners against Millwall on Saturday. The fifth-round tie at Selhurst Park was...

arts.ttl: Adam Wharton says player Arsenal sold for £20m is the fastest he’s ever seen
arts.sum: Arsenal have had some seriously quick footballers over the years. Even in the current Arsenal squad, the Gunners have some rapid players. Indeed, according to...

arts.ttl: Jean-Philippe Mateta recovering but Steve Parish shocked by ‘reckless’ challenge
arts.sum: Crystal Palace striker Mateta posted on social media that he was ‘doing well’ after being floored by Millwall keeper Liam Roberts early in the game.

arts.ttl: Millwall boss on having to scrap tactical plan after Roberts red card - with Palace transition strength a concern
arts.sum: Alex Neil has talked about having to adapt his Millwall tactics after Liam Roberts’ dismissal in today’s FA Cup loss to Crystal Palace. “We weren’t intending to use Josh the way we did,” said Lions head coach Neil.
